hero.title: Hero
hero.subtitle: Reclaim your agency and step into your power
hero.completionMessage: The Hero's journey is not about becoming fearless. It's about acting in the presence of fear. You have reclaimed your agency. Each small act of courage builds the next. You are no longer waiting for permission. You are the one who gives it.
hero.recommendedPractice: Daily Courage Log: Each morning, write one small courageous action you will take that day. Each evening, celebrate that you did it.

steps.title: Recognition - When Do You Feel Powerless?
steps.description: The Hero shadow appears when we feel stuck, small, or unable to act. This is where we begin - by naming the moments when your power feels absent.
steps.prompt: When do you feel most powerless? What stops you from taking action? Describe a recent situation where you felt stuck or unable to move forward.
steps.guidance: Be specific. Not 'I feel powerless sometimes' but 'I felt powerless when I wanted to speak up in the meeting but stayed silent.' The more concrete, the clearer the pattern.

steps.title: The Saboteur's Voice
steps.description: There is a voice that speaks right before you take action. It sounds reasonable, protective even. But it stops you. Let's listen to what it says.
steps.prompt: What does the voice say when you're about to succeed or take a risk? Write the exact words you hear internally.
steps.guidance: Don't argue with it yet. Just transcribe it like you're a journalist. What are the exact phrases it uses?

steps.title: Origin Story - When Did You Learn to Stay Small?
steps.description: This pattern didn't start yesterday. There was a moment, or many moments, when you learned it was safer to hold back than to step forward.
steps.prompt: When did you first learn it was safer to stay small? Was there a moment in childhood, adolescence, or early adulthood when taking action led to pain, shame, or rejection?
steps.guidance: You're not looking for perfect memory. You're looking for the feeling-tone of the lesson. Trust what comes.

steps.title: Cost Inventory - What Have You Abandoned?
steps.description: Staying stuck has a price. Dreams deferred. Relationships not pursued. Creative work left undone. Let's name what this pattern has cost you.
steps.prompt: What dreams have you abandoned? What opportunities have you let pass? What's the real cost of staying stuck? Name at least three specific things.
steps.guidance: This may hurt. That's okay. Grief is part of reclaiming power. Be honest about what you've sacrificed to stay safe.

steps.title: The Worthy Self - Who Would You Be?
steps.description: Imagine a version of you without this pattern. Not perfect, but free. Not fearless, but courageous. Who is that person?
steps.prompt: Who would you be without this pattern? Describe that version of yourself. How do they move through the world? What do they say yes to?
steps.guidance: This isn't fantasy. This is remembering who you actually are beneath the protection. Write in present tense.

steps.title: Micro-Courage Practice
steps.description: Courage isn't built in grand gestures. It's built in small, repeated acts of choosing action over fear.
steps.prompt: Choose one small act of courage for this week. Something that scares you just enough to matter, but small enough to actually do.

steps.title: Integration Ritual - Stepping Forward
steps.description: The body remembers what the mind forgets. Create a physical gesture that represents stepping into your power.
steps.prompt: Create a symbolic gesture of stepping forward. What feels right?
steps.guidance: Choose something you can repeat daily for 7 days. Make it simple, repeatable, and meaningful.

steps.title: Integration Summary
steps.description: You've named the pattern, heard the voice, honored the origin, counted the cost, and chosen courage. Now write your commitment.
steps.prompt: Write a 2-3 sentence commitment to yourself about how you will honor your Hero's journey this week.

lover.title: Lover
lover.subtitle: Reclaim healthy boundaries and authentic desire
lover.completionMessage: The Lover's healing is learning that your needs matter as much as anyone else's. You do not have to earn love by erasing yourself.
lover.recommendedPractice: Daily Desire Check-In: Each morning, ask yourself 'What do I want today?'

steps.title: Where Love Hurts
steps.description: The Lover shadow appears where connection becomes painful.
steps.prompt: Where do you give too much? Where do you abandon yourself for connection?

steps.title: The People Pleaser's Bargain
steps.description: When you please others at your own expense, there's always an unconscious hope.
steps.prompt: What do you hope to receive by pleasing others?
steps.guidance: This isn't manipulation - it's a survival strategy.

steps.title: Childhood Wounds
steps.description: You learned to abandon yourself somewhere.
steps.prompt: When did you learn your needs didn't matter?
steps.guidance: You may not have a specific memory. That's okay.

steps.title: Desire Inventory
steps.prompt: What does your body, your heart, your soul actually desire?
steps.guidance: Start small if you need to. Don't censor.

steps.title: Boundary Practice
steps.description: This week, you will practice one clear boundary.
steps.prompt: What's one boundary you need to set this week?

steps.title: Self-Love Ritual
steps.description: Now you will practice giving to yourself.
steps.prompt: Create a daily self-love practice you will do for 7 days.
steps.guidance: Start with 5 minutes. Self-love is a skill.

steps.title: Integration
steps.prompt: How will you honor your own heart going forward?
steps.guidance: You can love others AND love yourself.

warrior.title: Warrior
warrior.subtitle: Wield your strength with wisdom
warrior.completionMessage: The sacred Warrior protects without dominating.

steps.title: The Armor Check
steps.description: Where are your boundaries too rigid or too porous?
steps.prompt: Where are you over-controlling? Where are you too passive?

steps.title: Anger Archaeology
steps.prompt: What's beneath your need to control or your fear of conflict?

steps.title: The Wound
steps.description: When did you learn the world wasn't safe?
steps.prompt: When did you decide you had to control everything?

steps.title: Force vs Violence
steps.description: When is your anger protective? When destructive?

steps.title: Sacred Boundaries
steps.description: What boundaries would a healthy Warrior hold?
steps.prompt: What would you protect? What would you let go of controlling?

steps.title: Embodiment Practice
steps.description: Choose a physical practice for 7 days.

steps.title: Integration
steps.description: How will you wield your strength with wisdom?

sage.title: Sage
sage.subtitle: Transform self-criticism into compassionate wisdom
sage.completionMessage: You do not have to be perfect to be worthy.

steps.title: The Critic's Voice
steps.description: What does your inner critic say most often?

steps.title: The Impossible Standard
steps.description: Where did you learn you had to be perfect?

steps.title: Shame Inventory
steps.description: What are you most ashamed of?

steps.title: The Wise Witness
steps.description: What would a compassionate observer say?
steps.prompt: How would they speak to you?

steps.title: Reframe Practice
steps.prompt: Take one critical thought and reframe it.

steps.title: Integration
steps.description: How will you speak to yourself with kindness?

healer.title: Healer
healer.subtitle: Learn to receive and serve from fullness
healer.completionMessage: Self-care is not selfish - it's sustainable.

steps.title: The Martyr's Reward
steps.description: What do you get from being the one who saves others?
steps.prompt: Be truthful about the hidden reward.

steps.title: Childhood Role
steps.description: When did you become the caretaker?
steps.prompt: Who didn't take care of you?

steps.title: Receiving Practice
steps.description: What would it feel like to receive without giving back?

steps.title: Boundary Ritual
steps.description: Let others carry their own burden.
steps.prompt: What's one way you'll do this?

steps.title: Self-Healing
steps.prompt: Choose one daily practice for 7 days.

steps.title: Integration
steps.description: How will you serve from fullness?
steps.guidance: Include yourself in the circle of care.

steps.title: The Exile
steps.guidance: This is often the opposite of how you present.

steps.title: The Banishment Story
steps.description: When did you decide this part was unacceptable?

steps.title: Shadow Dialogue
steps.prompt: What would it say to you?

steps.title: Radical Welcome
steps.description: Can you welcome this part back with compassion?

steps.title: New Relationship
steps.description: How will you relate to this part?

saboteur.title: The Saboteur
saboteur.completionMessage: The Saboteur loses power when seen clearly. You now know its timing, its fears, and its cost. Each time you catch it and act anyway, you reclaim your right to succeed.
saboteur.recommendedPractice: Saboteur Journal: For 7 days, log each sabotage impulse.

steps.title: When Do You Sabotage?
steps.description: The Saboteur strikes at specific moments.
steps.prompt: Describe a recent time you were close to success and something got in the way.

steps.title: The Saboteur's Timing
steps.prompt: Does self-sabotage happen right before success, after a win, when visible, or when making progress?

steps.title: The Hidden Fear
steps.description: What are you actually afraid of if you succeed?

steps.title: 48-Hour Awareness Practice
steps.description: Notice the impulse. Name the fear. Act anyway.

victim.title: The Victim
victim.tagline: Externalizes power, feels helpless and stuck
victim.completionMessage: You are not as powerless as the story says. You can act.

steps.title: The Hidden Safety
steps.description: What does powerlessness protect you from?
steps.prompt: Be honest about what you gain.

steps.title: The One Choice
steps.description: What is ONE thing you can control?
steps.guidance: It doesn't have to fix everything.

avoider.title: The Avoider
avoider.completionMessage: Two minutes proves you can face what you fear.

steps.title: What Are You Afraid Will Happen?
steps.prompt: What are you afraid you'll feel?

steps.title: The Two-Minute Action
steps.prompt: What could you do in 120 seconds?

imposter.title: The Imposter
imposter.tagline: Believes they're fraudulent despite evidence of competence
imposter.completionMessage: You are not a fraud. You are skilled. The evidence is real.

steps.title: When Do You Feel Like a Fraud?
How Do You Dismiss Your Competence?
steps.prompt: How do you explain away success?

steps.title: When Did You Decide You Weren't Enough?
steps.description: When did you first feel this?

people_pleaser.title: The People Pleaser
people_pleaser.tagline: Abandons self to gain approval and avoid conflict
people_pleaser.completionMessage: You are allowed to say no. You are allowed to disappoint people.

steps.title: What Are You Afraid Will Happen?

addict.title: The Addict
addict.tagline: Uses compulsion and numbing to escape emotional pain
addict.completionMessage: You can feel discomfort for 5 minutes and survive. The urge will pass.

steps.title: What Do You Use to Escape?

disconnected_lover.title: The Disconnected Lover
disconnected_lover.tagline: Locked away from intimacy and sensuality
disconnected_lover.completionMessage: Your body remembers how to feel. You can learn to be alive again.

controller.title: The Controller
controller.tagline: Over-manages to avoid vulnerability and uncertainty
controller.completionMessage: You can let go of control in small ways and survive. You can tolerate uncertainty.

steps.title: What Are You Afraid Will Happen?

tyrant.title: The Tyrant
tyrant.completionMessage: True strength is knowing when to yield. Your vulnerability is courage.

rebel.title: The Rebel
rebel.completionMessage: True freedom is choosing - sometimes yes, sometimes no, always conscious.

timid_warrior.title: The Timid Warrior
timid_warrior.tagline: Cannot hold boundaries or access healthy force
timid_warrior.completionMessage: Boundaries are not violence. You are allowed to protect yourself.

steps.title: What Are You Afraid Your Force Will Do?

inner_critic.title: The Inner Critic
inner_critic.completionMessage: Perfection is a prison. You can thank the Critic and stop believing it.

judge.title: The Judge
judge.tagline: Projects moral superiority and criticizes others
judge.completionMessage: Curiosity connects you. You can discern without condemning.

steps.title: What Does Judgment Protect You From?
What Are You Judging in Yourself?

martyr.title: The Martyr
martyr.tagline: Over-gives to avoid own needs and rescues compulsively
martyr.completionMessage: You are worthy without giving everything away. Receiving is human.

steps.title: What Do You Earn Through Sacrifice?

wounded_healer.title: The Wounded Healer
wounded_healer.tagline: Serves from depletion and cannot receive care
wounded_healer.completionMessage: Your wounds deserve care. Tend yourself first.

steps.title: Why Don't You Tend Your Own Wounds?

orphan.title: The Orphan
orphan.completionMessage: You are not as alone as the wound says. You can risk connection.

exile.title: The Exile
exile.tagline: Disowned aspects and rejected parts of self
exile.completionMessage: You can welcome it back. You are becoming whole.

steps.title: Why Did You Exile This Part?
How Does the Exile Speak Now?
What Gift Does the Exile Hold?
